episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a range of fascinating topics, including the unique clothing practices of the Inca Emperor, the prevalence of parental favoritism, the unexpected death of Robert Louis Stevenson while making mayonnaise, and a bizarre NASA-funded project to teach dolphins to speak English.

facts.fact: The Emperor of the Incas only ever wore an outfit once, after which it was immediately burned.
About 70% of parents admit to having a favourite child.
Robert Louis Stevenson died halfway through making a batch of mayonnaise.

In the 1960s, NASA helped to fund a scientific project that aimed to teach dolphins to speak the English language so perfectly that they would be given a chair at the United Nations to speak on behalf of marine mammals.
